repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: border value is hardcoded

Solution: get it from config interface

comment_data.body: is there a generic float class that `vim.diagnostic.Opts.Float` can inherit from?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -152,6 +152,8 @@ local M = {}
 --- @field suffix? string|table|(fun(diagnostic:vim.Diagnostic,i:integer,total:integer): string, string)
 ---
 --- @field focus_id? string
+---
+--- @field border? string

comment_data.body:
could use `vim.tbl_get`.  

side-note:  should `vim.tbl_get` allow non-table input? that would make it more flexible, but less strict.

```suggestion
      local border = vim.tbl_get(config, 'float', 'border') or 'rounded'
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,7 +190,10 @@ do
     })
 
     vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-W>d', function()
-      vim.diagnostic.open_float({ border = 'rounded' })
+      local config = vim.diagnostic.config()
+      local border = type(config.float) == 'table' and (config.float.border or 'rounded')
+        or 'rounded'

@@ -190,7 +190,10 @@ do
     })
 
     vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-W>d', function()
-      vim.diagnostic.open_float({ border = 'rounded' })
+      local config = vim.diagnostic.config()
+      local border = type(config.float) == 'table' and (config.float.border or 'rounded')
+        or 'rounded'

comment_data.body: just search float in help doc seems like we don't have a float class  ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -152,6 +152,8 @@ local M = {}
 --- @field suffix? string|table|(fun(diagnostic:vim.Diagnostic,i:integer,total:integer): string, string)
 ---
 --- @field focus_id? string
+---
+--- @field border? string

comment_data.body: yeah i don't see one in `runtime/lua/vim/_meta/api.lua`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -152,6 +152,8 @@ local M = {}
 --- @field suffix? string|table|(fun(diagnostic:vim.Diagnostic,i:integer,total:integer): string, string)
 ---
 --- @field focus_id? string
+---
+--- @field border? string

comment_data.body:
IMO just leave `float` unspecified here and fallback to whatever vim.diagnostic.config() does. `open_float()` already uses vim.diagnostic.config(), I don’t think we need to check it ourselves here “manually”.

```suggestion
      vim.diagnostic.open_float()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,7 +190,9 @@ do
     })
 
     vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-W>d', function()
-      vim.diagnostic.open_float({ border = 'rounded' })
+      local config = vim.diagnostic.config()
+      local border = vim.tbl_get(config, 'float', 'border') or 'rounded'
+      vim.diagnostic.open_float({ border = border })

comment_data.body: Can we link to nvim_open_win so that users know what valid values for this option are?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -499,6 +499,7 @@ Lua module: vim.diagnostic                                    *diagnostic-api*
                           diagnostic instead of prepending it. Overrides the
                           setting from |vim.diagnostic.config()|.
       • {focus_id}?       (`string`)
+      • {border}?         (`string`)

comment_data.body:
not a valid tag. that's why docs ci is failing
```suggestion
      • {border}?         (`string`) see |vim.api.nvim_open_win()|.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -499,6 +499,7 @@ Lua module: vim.diagnostic                                    *diagnostic-api*
                           diagnostic instead of prepending it. Overrides the
                           setting from |vim.diagnostic.config()|.
       • {focus_id}?       (`string`)
+      • {border}?         (`string`) see |vim.api.nvim_open_win|.

comment_regular_data.body: Would it be an option to have a global `float_border` option? The border is also a frequent config option for plugins and in some LSP methods. It would be great if a user would only have to configure it once instead of per module/functionality to have consistent borders

> Would it be an option to have a global `float_border` option?

a 'winoptions' or 'winstyle' option is probably needed at some point. 

but this PR seems good meanwhile, because this mapping is for diagnostics specifically.

> Would it be an option to have a global `float_border` option? The border is also a frequent config option for plugins and in some LSP methods. It would be great if a user would only have to configure it once instead of per module/functionality to have consistent borders

Related: `vim.ui.config()` https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/25514

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

title: fix(diagnostic): get border from config
